intro: Halenia multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered halenia, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Halenia multiflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
